exceptions.exn: In environment K : AbsRing x : K e : posreal Unable to unify "0 < Rabs ?M2419" with "abs (minus x x) < e".

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing

Goal:
forall (x : K) (e : posreal), AbsRing_ball x e x

Premises:
AbsRing_ball = fun (x : K) (eps : R) (y : K) => abs (minus y x) < eps : K -> R -> K -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ R_scope _]
Record posreal : Set := mkposreal { pos : R; cond_pos : 0 < pos } For mkposreal: Argument scopes are [R_scope _]
ball_center : forall (x : ?M) (e : posreal), ball x e x where ?M : [K : AbsRing |- UniformSpace]
UniformSpace.ax1 : forall (M : Type) (m : UniformSpace.mixin_of M) (x : M) (e : posreal), UniformSpace.ball M m x e x
UniformSpace.ax2 : forall (M : Type) (m : UniformSpace.mixin_of M) (x y : M) (e : R), UniformSpace.ball M m x e y -> UniformSpace.ball M m y e x
Record mixin_of (M : Type) : Type := Mixin { ball : M -> R -> M -> Prop; ax1 : forall (x : M) (e : posreal), ball x e x; ax2 : forall (x y : M) (e : R), ball x e y -> ball y e x; ax3 : forall (x y z : M) (e1 e2 : R), ball x e1 y -> ball y e2 z -> ball x (e1 + e2) z } For mixin_of: Argument scope is [type_scope] For Mixin: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
AbsRing.ax5 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x : K), AbsRing.abs K m x = 0 -> x = zero
AbsRing.ax3 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (plus x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x + AbsRing.abs K m y
AbsRing.ax4 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (mult x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x * AbsRing.abs K m y
Rabs_mult : forall x y : R, Rabs (x * y) = Rabs x * Rabs y
Boule_lt : forall (c : R) (r : posreal) (x : R), Boule c r x -> Rabs x < Rabs c + r
abs_pow_n : forall (x : ?K) (n : nat), abs (pow_n x n) <= abs x ^ n where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- AbsRing]
seq.last_nth : forall (T : Type) (x0 x : T) (s : list T), seq.last x s = seq.nth x0 (x :: s) (seq.size s)
pow_n = fun K : Ring => fix pow_n (x : K) (N : nat) {struct N} : K := match N with | 0%nat => one | S i => mult x (pow_n x i) end : forall K : Ring, K -> nat -> K Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ nat_scope]
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
Heine_cor2 : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R), (forall x : R, a <= x <= b -> continuity_pt f x) -> forall eps : posreal, {delta : posreal | forall x y : R, a <= x <= b -> a <= y <= b -> Rabs (x - y) < delta -> Rabs (f x - f y) < eps}
one = fun K : Ring => Ring.one (AbelianGroup.Pack K (Ring.class K) K) (Ring.class K) : forall K : Ring, K Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
Rabs_pos_eq : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> Rabs x = x
Rmin_l : forall x y : R, Rmin x y <= x
abs = fun K : AbsRing => AbsRing.abs (Ring.Pack K (AbsRing.class K) K) (AbsRing.class K) : forall K : AbsRing, K -> R Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
abs_zero = fun K : AbsRing => AbsRing.ax1 (Ring.Pack K (AbsRing.class K) K) (AbsRing.class K) : forall K : AbsRing, abs zero = 0 Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
Rabs_pos : forall x : R, 0 <= Rabs x
opp_mult_m1 : forall x : ?K, opp x = mult (opp one) x where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]
Rabs_pos_lt : forall x : R, x <> 0 -> 0 < Rabs x
mult = fun K : Ring => Ring.mult (AbelianGroup.Pack K (Ring.class K) K) (Ring.class K) : forall K : Ring, K -> K -> K Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
abs_eq_zero : forall x : ?K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- AbsRing]
plus_comm : forall x y : ?G, plus x y = plus y x where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
Heine_cor1 : forall (f : R -> R) (a b : R), a < b -> (forall x : R, a <= x <= b -> continuity_pt f x) -> forall eps : posreal, {delta : posreal | delta <= b - a /\ (forall x y : R, a <= x <= b -> a <= y <= b -> Rabs (x - y) < delta -> Rabs (f x - f y) < eps)}
close = fun (M : UniformSpace) (x y : M) => forall eps : posreal, ball x eps y : forall M : UniformSpace, M -> M -> Prop Argument M is implicit and maximally inserted
AbsRing.mixin : forall (K : Type) (c : AbsRing.class_of K), AbsRing.mixin_of (Ring.Pack K c K)
abs_ge_0 : forall x : ?K, 0 <= abs x where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- AbsRing]
Rmin_r : forall x y : R, Rmin x y <= y

```coq
intros x e.
unfold AbsRing_ball.
simpl.
apply Rabs_pos_lt.
intro H.
apply Rlt_irrefl with 0.
rewrite <- H.
apply cond_pos.
Qed.
```

original: intros x e. unfold AbsRing_ball. simpl. apply Rabs_pos_lt. intro H. apply Rlt_irrefl with 0. rewrite <- H. apply cond_pos.
